episodeTitle: The Dashing Sea Train and the City of Water: Water Seven!
episodeTitleJapanese: 疾走海列車と水の都ウォーターセブン
episodeTitleRomanized: Shissō umi ressha to mizu no miyako Uōtā Seven
description: After recovering from their encounter with Admiral Aokiji, the Straw Hat crew encounters a giant frog swimming the front crawl and narrowly avoids collision with the Puffing Tom sea train. They meet Kokoro, an old station master, and her granddaughter Chimney, who guide them to Water 7, the city of water famous for shipbuilding.

mangaChapters.chapterTitle: Adventure in the City on the Water

events.title: Straw Hats Recover from Aokiji Encounter
events.description: The crew has fully recovered from their devastating encounter with Admiral Aokiji. Sanji prepares potato paille for the crew while Luffy jokes about having been frozen. Robin finally emerges after taking longer to recover and asks for coffee.
events.significance: Establishes the transition from the previous arc and shows the crew has moved past their traumatic encounter with Admiral Aokiji, setting the stage for their arrival at Water 7.

events.title: Yokozuna the Giant Frog Spotted
events.description: Zoro spots a giant frog swimming the front crawl (freestyle stroke) in the ocean. The crew is amazed by the unusual sight of a frog swimming in a style typically associated with humans rather than the natural breaststroke of frogs.
events.significance: First appearance of Yokozuna, a giant frog who becomes a recurring character in the Water 7 arc. The humorous scene establishes the unique creatures of this region and foreshadows Franky's later introduction.

quotes.text: It's a frog doing the front crawl!
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's observation of the unusual swimming frog

events.title: Puffing Tom Sea Train Nearly Collides with Going Merry
events.description: The Going Merry narrowly escapes being hit by the Puffing Tom, a massive sea train traveling on underwater tracks. The crew is shocked by the existence of a train running across the ocean, introducing them to the revolutionary transportation system of the region.
events.significance: First appearance of the Puffing Tom sea train, a crucial element of the Water 7 arc's plot. The sea train was built by the legendary shipwright Tom and connects Water 7 to other islands including Enies Lobby, which becomes central to the upcoming storyline.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's shocked reaction to seeing the sea train

events.title: Meeting Kokoro, Chimney, and Gonbe
events.description: The Straw Hats meet Kokoro, an elderly woman and sea train station master, along with her granddaughter Chimney (age 8) and Chimney's pet rabbit Gonbe (whom Chimney insists is a cat). Kokoro provides the crew with crucial information about Water 7 and the sea train system.
events.significance: First appearance of three important characters who will play significant roles in the Water 7 and Enies Lobby arcs. Kokoro later reveals herself to be a mermaid and helps rescue the Straw Hats during the Aqua Laguna. This meeting also introduces the crew to the sea train system and provides them a map to Water 7.

quotes.speaker: Chimney
quotes.context: Chimney introducing her rabbit pet that she thinks is a cat

quotes.text: Nagagagaga! Welcome to Shift Station, young pirates!
quotes.speaker: Kokoro
quotes.context: Kokoro's distinctive laugh as she greets the Straw Hats

events.title: Kokoro Explains the Sea Train System
events.description: Kokoro provides detailed information about the revolutionary sea train system created by the legendary shipwright Tom. She explains that the Puffing Tom connects multiple islands including Water 7, St. Poplar, San Faldo, Pucci, and the government's judicial island Enies Lobby.
events.significance: Establishes crucial world-building information about Tom's Workers and the sea train system that becomes central to the Water 7 and Enies Lobby arcs. The mention of Enies Lobby foreshadows the upcoming conflict with the World Government.

events.title: First Glimpse of Water 7
events.description: The crew catches their first sight of Water 7, the magnificent city of water. Built like Venice with colorful tiered buildings, waterways serving as roads, and distinctive architecture, the city is revealed as a major hub for shipbuilding in the Grand Line.
events.significance: First appearance of Water 7, one of the most important locations in One Piece. This city becomes the setting for major events including the Going Merry's fate, Usopp's departure and return, Robin's disappearance, Franky's introduction, and the revelation of CP9. The Water 7 arc is considered one of the series' best.

quotes.text: Whoa! It's amazing! A whole city on the water!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first reaction to seeing Water 7

events.title: Going Merry's Mast Collapses
events.description: While taking in the sails, the Going Merry's mast suddenly collapses, revealing the extent of damage the ship has sustained through their journey. The crew is shocked by this failure, realizing their beloved ship is in worse condition than they thought.
events.significance: Foreshadows the major conflict about the Going Merry's fate that will divide the crew and lead to Usopp's temporary departure. This moment establishes the urgency of finding a skilled shipwright in Water 7 to assess and repair their ship.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's distress at the mast collapsing

events.title: Introduction of Yagara Bulls
events.description: Luffy, Nami, and Usopp purchase rides on Yagara Bulls, the primary mode of transportation in Water 7. These seahorse-like fish creatures swim with their heads above water and pull two-seat carriages, serving as the water city's equivalent of taxis.
events.significance: First appearance of Yagara Bulls, the iconic transportation method of Water 7. These creatures become a recurring element throughout the Water 7 arc and showcase the unique adaptation of the city's inhabitants to their aquatic environment.

events.title: Crew Discusses Recruiting a Shipwright
events.description: The Straw Hats discuss the need to recruit a skilled shipwright to join their crew permanently. Sanji jokes about wanting an attractive female member, Luffy emphasizes wanting someone strong, and Zoro insists on competence and skill above all else.
events.significance: Sets up the recruitment of Franky, who will become the crew's shipwright and the eighth member to join the Straw Hat Pirates. This discussion establishes the crew's awareness that Usopp's repairs are insufficient for the challenges of the Grand Line.

quotes.text: We definitely need a shipwright. Someone who can really fix the ship properly.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami emphasizing the crew's need for a professional shipwright

events.title: Kokoro Mentions Iceburg and Galley-La Company
events.description: Kokoro gives the crew a letter of introduction to Iceburg, the mayor of Water 7 and president of the Galley-La Company, the world's premier shipbuilding company. She explains that Galley-La is famous throughout the Grand Line for constructing the finest ships.
events.significance: Introduces Iceburg and Galley-La Company, which become central to the Water 7 arc. Iceburg is revealed to be Tom's former apprentice alongside Franky. The Galley-La Company is later revealed to be infiltrated by CP9 agents, leading to major plot developments.

themes.description: The episode marks a major transition as the crew moves from the aftermath of their encounter with Admiral Aokiji to the beginning of the Water 7 arc. The introduction of a vibrant new city, unique transportation systems, and friendly new characters signals a fresh chapter in their journey.
themes.symbolism: The sea train represents technological progress and connectivity in the One Piece world, while Water 7's unique architecture symbolizes adaptation and innovation in the face of environmental challenges (the sinking city).
culturalReferences: Japanese train culture reflected in the sea train system

themes.description: The Going Merry's deteriorating condition serves as a reminder that even beloved things cannot last forever. The collapsing mast foreshadows the difficult decision the crew will face about their ship's fate.
themes.symbolism: The damaged Going Merry represents the consequences of the crew's adventures and the harsh reality that their journey takes a toll on everything, including their most precious possessions.
culturalReferences: Japanese concept of mono no aware (the pathos of things)

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a helpful station master who provides the Straw Hats with crucial information and guidance to Water 7. Her mermaid heritage is not yet revealed.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as an energetic and cheerful 8-year-old girl who accompanies her grandmother Kokoro. Her innocent misidentification of Gonbe as a cat provides comic relief.
keyActions: Meets the Straw Hats with Kokoro

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended some scenes of the crew's interactions aboard the Going Merry and added more reaction shots when they first see Water 7.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Water 7, which is inspired by Venice, Italy, with its canal system and distinctive architecture.
Yokozuna, the giant frog doing the front crawl, is a humorous subversion since real frogs naturally swim using the breaststroke. The front crawl is typically a human swimming technique.
The opening theme 'Kokoro no Chizu' (Map of the Heart) by BOYSTYLE was the first One Piece opening to be aired in widescreen format and the first to lack opening narration.

sources.title: Kokoro no Chizu - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Chimney insists that Gonbe is a cat, despite him clearly being a rabbit with long ears and a cotton tail. This running gag continues throughout the arc.
Kokoro is later revealed to be an icefish mermaid, though her mermaid nature is not disclosed in this episode. At age 70, she has a split tail that allows her to walk on land.
